comment: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. This is the indexed union version of ~ unifi . Note that ` B ` depends on ` x ` , i.e. can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
